meanings.definition: A sign or warning that something momentous or calamitous is likely to happen.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds gathering in the sky were a portent of the coming storm.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature was a portent of the approaching winter.
meanings.sent3: The chirping of the birds in the evening was a cheerful portent of a peaceful night ahead.
meanings.sent4: The howling wind outside served as a portent of the fierce storm to come.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor saw the red sky at night as a portent of fair weather the next day.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that foreshadows a future event.
meanings.sent1: The wise old owl was considered a portent of good luck by the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The black cat crossing one's path is often seen as a portent of bad luck.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy running around the house was a delightful portent of the family's upcoming joy.
meanings.sent4: The blooming flowers in the garden were a colorful portent of the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent5: The shooting star was seen as a magical portent of wishes about to come true.
